Package ca.yapper.yapperapp.Databases

Class OrganizerDatabase

java.lang.Object
ca.yapper.yapperapp.Databases.OrganizerDatabase
public class OrganizerDatabase extends Object
Class holding all the organizer related functions that interact with the database.

    • checkIfUserIsAdmin

      public static com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Boolean> checkIfUserIsAdmin(String deviceId)
      Checks if the user is an admin based on their device ID.
      Parameters:
      deviceId - The unique device ID of the user.
      Returns:
      A Task that resolves to true if the user is an admin, false otherwise.

    • getEventDetails

      public static void getEventDetails(String eventId, OrganizerDatabase.OnEventDetailsFetchListener listener)
      This function obtains an event from the database using the eventId
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique id for the event, created from the QR code.
      listener - handles the outcome of the event loading operation

    • removeUserFromSelectedList

      public static void removeUserFromSelectedList(String eventId, String userId, OrganizerDatabase.OnOperationCompleteListener listener)
      This function removes a given user from the selected list of a given event.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The id for the event
      userId - The id for the user, created from the device id.
      listener - handles the outcome of the operation

      This function obtains events from the database using the eventID
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique id for the event, created from the QR code.
      listener - handles the outcome of the user check

    • checkUserInEvent

      public static void checkUserInEvent(String eventId, String userId, OrganizerDatabase.OnUserCheckListener listener)
      This function checks if a user is in an events selected or waiting list, by iterating through both lists.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique id for the event, created from the QR code.
      userId - The id for the user, created from the device id.
      listener - handles the outcome of the user check

    • loadUserIdsFromSubcollection

      public static void loadUserIdsFromSubcollection(String eventId, String subcollectionName, OrganizerDatabase.OnUserIdsLoadedListener listener)
      This function gets users from a given subcollection and obtains their device IDs from the users collection, then adds them to a device Id list.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique id for the event, created from the QR code.
      subcollectionName - name of the specified subcollection we want to load user from
      listener - handles the outcome of loading the user Ids

    • getInvitationStatusFromEvent

      public static void getInvitationStatusFromEvent(String eventId, String userId, OrganizerDatabase.OnStatusCheckListener listener)
      This function obtains the status of the event invitations for a given user, for a specific event
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique id for the event, created from the QR code.
      userId - The id for the user, created from the device id.
      listener - handles the outcome of the status check

    • changeUserStatusForEvent

      public static void changeUserStatusForEvent(String eventId, String userId, String status, OrganizerDatabase.OnOperationCompleteListener listener)
      This function changes the given users status in the joined events lists for a given event [UNUSED]
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique id for the event, created from the QR code.
      userId - The id for the user, created from the device id.
      status - the users status in the event
      listener - handles the outcome of the operation

    • moveUserBetweenEventSubcollections

      public static void moveUserBetweenEventSubcollections(String eventId, String userId, String fromSubcollection, String toSubcollection, OrganizerDatabase.OnOperationCompleteListener listener)
      This function moves a user between two given subcollections
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique id for the event, created from the QR code.
      userId - The id for the user, created from the device id.
      fromSubcollection - a string representing the starter sub collection that the user was in
      toSubcollection - a string representing the goal sub collection to move user to

    • loadEventCapacity

      public static void loadEventCapacity(String eventId, OrganizerDatabase.OnEventCapLoadedListener listener)
      This function obtains the event capacity for a given event.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique id for the event, created from the QR code.
      listener - handles the outcome of loading the event capacity

    • createEventInDatabase

      public static void createEventInDatabase(int capacity, String dateTime, String description, String facilityLocation, String facilityName, boolean isGeolocationEnabled, String name, String registrationDeadline, Integer waitListCapacity, String organizerId, String posterBase64, OrganizerDatabase.OnOperationCompleteListener listener)
      This function creates and saves a new event in Firestore with the provided details.
      Parameters:
      capacity - The maximum number of attendees.
      dateTime - The event date and time.
      description - The description of the event.
      facilityLocation - The location of the event.
      facilityName - The name of the facility.
      isGeolocationEnabled - Whether geolocation is enabled for the event.
      name - The name of the event.
      registrationDeadline - The registration deadline for the event.
      waitListCapacity - Capacity of the waiting list.
      organizerId - The ID of the organizer creating the event.

    • addEventToAllUsersMissedOut

      private static com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> addEventToAllUsersMissedOut(String eventId)
      This function adds a given event to each users "Missed Out" events collection.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique id for the event, created from the QR code.
      Returns:
      a task that return complete when all users have had the event added to the sub collection. Otherwise fails.

    • moveUserToSelectedList

      public static void moveUserToSelectedList(String eventId, String userId, OrganizerDatabase.OnOperationCompleteListener listener)
      This function moves a given user from an events waiting list to its selected list.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique id for the event, created from the QR code.
      userId - The id for the user, created from the device id.
      listener - handles the outcome of the operation

      listener - handles the outcome of the data fetch

      listener - handles the outcome of loading the organizer details

    • saveEventData

      public static void saveEventData(String eventId, Map<String,Object> eventData, OrganizerDatabase.OnOperationCompleteListener listener)
      This function saves the event details to the database
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique id for the event, created from the QR code.
      eventData - Event data is a map that contains various details regarding the given event
      listener - handles the outcome of the operation

    • updateFacilityNameForEvents

      public static com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> updateFacilityNameForEvents(String userId, String facilityName)
      This function individually updates the facility name for each event attached to the given facility
      Parameters:
      userId - The id for the user, created from the device id.
      facilityName - The name of the facility attached to an organizer
      Returns:
      this returns a task that succeeds if the operation was a success

    • updateFacilityAddressForEvents

      public static com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> updateFacilityAddressForEvents(String userId, String facilityLocation)
      This function updates the facility address for each event attached to the facility
      Parameters:
      userId - The id for the user, created from the device id.
      facilityLocation - This is a string representing the facilities location
      Returns:
      this returns a task that succeeds if the operation was a success

    • checkQRCodeExists

      public static com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Boolean> checkQRCodeExists(String eventId)
      This function checks if a given event has a QR Code
      Parameters:
      eventId - The id for the event
      Returns:
      a call to the database that returns true if the QR code exists for a given event
